boardgame.name: Kill Doctor Lucky
Kill Doctor Lucky: Director_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Cut
Kill Doktor Lucky
特選ゲーム Dr.ラッキーを殺せ
boardgame.description: In this notorious game, an inversion of Clue, you hate Doctor Lucky. Maybe he left you out of his will. Maybe he killed your pet rock. Whatever the reason, you want him dead. Unfortunately, so do the other players. Since you don't want to go to jail, you need to make your attempt in secret; if anybody can see you, whistle nonchalantly, and let the Doctor live ... until next time._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Players move around the mansion, collecting murder weapons (to make the murder attempt stronger - doubly so if the weapon is used in an appropriate location); failure cards (to thwart opponents' plans); and movement cards (to try to get together with Doctor Lucky in a secluded location for his inevitable demise.) Players try to convince others to use up their failure cards first, the better for when their own attempts come._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Titanic Games (TGL 1000) The Origins Award–winning board game from Cheapass Games comes to your gaming table in a new full-color, high-quality deluxe edition featuring components on par with the best European board games. Kill Doctor Lucky pits 3 to 7 players against each other in a race to see who can kill Doctor Lucky. The trick is that all the other players want to do it first and will stop at nothing to prevent you from having the pleasure. And the old doctor has earned his nickname well: he_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s got more lives than Rasputin and an uncanny knack for dodging your best traps. But his luck can_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t last forever. Before the game is over, someone is going to kill Doctor Lucky—wouldn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t you rather it were you? Everyone starts in the Drawing Room, and everyone wants to kill Doctor Lucky. Players move around the mansion looking for weapons and trying to catch the old man alone. Trying to kill the Doctor is pretty easy, but every other player can play Failure cards to stop you. Doctor Lucky_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s luck runs out eventually, though, and you just hope you can catch him when it does. Contents: Full-color board of the Lucky Mansion 96 full-color cards 8 pawns 30 spite tokens Full-color rules sheet

Original Cheapass Games version in black and white, in very good condition. Includes playing pieces. ***This is NOT the deluxe color version*** Shipping is $9. Please ask about combined shipping for multiple items.
Cheapass Games version. Never played and in excellent condition. Shipping will be actual postage charge.

The original 1997 out of print version in a paper envelope. Paizo Publishing (PZO 5501) The Origins Award - winning board game from Cheapass Games comes to your gaming table in a new full-color, high-quality deluxe edition featuring components on par with the best European board games. Kill Doctor Lucky pits 3 to 7 players against each other in a race to see who can kill Doctor Lucky. The trick is that all the other players want to do it first and will stop at nothing to prevent you from having the pleasure. And the old doctor has earned his nickname well: he_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s got more lives than Rasputin and an uncanny knack for dodging your best traps. But his luck can_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t last forever. Before the game is over, someone is going to kill Doctor Lucky - wouldn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t you rather it were you? Everyone starts in the Drawing Room, and everyone wants to kill Doctor Lucky. Players move around the mansion looking for weapons and trying to catch the old man alone. Trying to kill the Doctor is pretty easy, but every other player can play Failure cards to stop you. Doctor Lucky_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s luck runs out eventually, though, and you just hope you can catch him when it does. This new edition now includes the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;...And His Little Dog Too!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; expansion - three rules variants that feature Doctor Lucky_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s dog, Shamrock. He_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s just as lucky as his master and has an annoying habit of making you feel fond of him.

This is the Titanic Games version. The box shows some signs of wear but is in good shape overall. The components are in very good to excellent condition. It is 100% complete. Also included is the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;And His Little Dog Too_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;expansion. The expansion is in mint condition. Shipping is included.

Paizo Publishing (PZO 5501) Yeah, yeah, yeah. Murder mysteries are a dime a dozen, but here_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s the ultimate twist. There_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s this guy named Doctor Lucky and he needs to die. Now its a race to be the one to pull it off. In this ultimate Clue parody, you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll find a bevy of locations in his mansion to pull off the deed. First you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll need to secure a weapon and then make sure there are no witnesses when the time is right. To _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Kill Doctor Lucky_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; is no easy task, since he certainly lives up to his name. Every failed attempt wins you spite points. These make you stronger in your next attempt on Doctor Lucky or to thwart one of you scheming competitor_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s plans. Though play cards are randomly drawn, it takes a great deal of strategy to position yourself in the right place at the right time.
for user Vishnianini

CHEAPASS GAMES (CAG230) Kill Doctor Lucky was the very first Cheapass Game, a _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;pre-mystery_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; game in which the goal is explained in the title. Every player is a murderer visiting Lucky Mansion, and the first player to kill Doctor Lucky wins. But he_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s not called _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Doctor Lucky_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; for nothing: he_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s notoriously hard to kill. This is the 19.5th Anniversary Edition of Kill Doctor Lucky, featuring all-new art by Israel Evans (Get Lucky). This edition contains dramatically updated rules, so it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s cleaner, faster, and more tactical than ever before.
